Work experience.Description: Provided support and assistance with daily tasks to a 14-year-old migrant girl. The girl had difficulties with language, cultural adaptation, and social integration.
Provided academic supervision and assistance to two groups of students between 11 and 14 years old. The majority of students had learning and/or behavioral difficulties.
Monitored leisure and free time activities for children aged 6, 7, and 8 years old.
Administered cognitive tests, developed Individualized Care Plans (ICPs), provided emotional support, and implemented cognitive stimulation exercises.
Monitored leisure and free time activities for children aged 6, 7, and 8 years old.

Work experience.Position: Practical Training in General Health Psychology
Work experience.Description: Provided psychological care to adults with mental health diagnoses. Participated in a Labor Insertion Team and a Day Hospital at the Comunidad Terapéutica del Maresme under the supervision of clinical psychologists in both cases. Currently collaborating with the Individualized Support Plan team.
Monitored and educated a 7-year-old boy with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD).

Work experience.Position: Volunteer at the Spanish Association Against Cancer (AECC)
Work experience.Description: Provides companionship to cancer patients at the Hospital Clinic de Barcelona.

Academic background.Description: Participation in a study on weight discrimination, eating disorders, and psychological well-being in adolescents led by David Sánchez Carracedo and funded by the Government of Spain.
